<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
12. Benefit Plans:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company sponsors noncontributory defined benefit pension plans
covering substantially all U.S. employees. Pension coverage for employees of
the Company&#146;s non-U.S. subsidiaries is provided, to the extent deemed
appropriate, through separate plans, many of which are governed by local
statutory requirements. In addition, the Company&#146;s U.S. and Canadian
subsidiaries provide health care and other benefits to substantially all
retired employees. Health care benefits for retirees outside the United States
and Canada are generally covered through local government plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Pension Plans</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Components
of Net Periodic Benefit Cost</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net periodic
pension cost consisted of the following for the nine months and three months
ended September 30, 2006 and 2005:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="304" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:228.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net periodic pension
  cost</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="55" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">56</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="55" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">43</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="55" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="55" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 20.7pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other expense, above, is due primarily to additional pension benefits
related to workforce reduction programs under the Company&#146;s restructuring
program and is included as part of asset impairment and exit costs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Employer
Contributions</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
presently makes, and plans to make, contributions, to the extent that they are
tax deductible or do not generate an excise tax liability, in order to maintain
plan assets in excess of the accumulated benefit obligation of its funded U.S.
and non-U.S. plans.&#160; During the nine
months ended September 30, 2006, $140 million and $67 million of employer contributions
were made to U.S. plans and non-U.S. plans, respectively.&#160; Currently, the Company anticipates making
additional contributions of approximately $10 million during the remainder of
2006 to its U.S. plans and approximately $40 million during the remainder of
2006 to its non-U.S. plans, based on current tax law.&#160; However, these estimates are subject to
change as a result of many factors, including changes in tax and other benefit
laws, as well as asset performance significantly above or below the assumed
long-term rate of return on pension assets, or significant changes in interest
rates.&#160; During the nine months ended
September 30, 2005, $207 million and $64 million of employer contributions were
made to U.S. plans and non-U.S. plans, respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">27</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='27',FILE='C:\fc\30711747751_D11265_1457033\21892-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Nov  3 11:07 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"></p>


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed
Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net postretirement
health care costs consisted of the following for the nine months and three
months ended September 30, 2006 and 2005:</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="54" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:40.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September 2006, the FASB issued SFAS No. 158, &#147;Employers&#146; Accounting
for Defined Benefit Pension and Other Postretirement Plans (&#147;SFAS No. 158&#148;).&#160; SFAS No. 158 requires that employers
recognize the funded status of their defined benefit pension and other
postretirement plans on the consolidated balance sheet and recognize as a
component of other comprehensive income, net of tax, the gains or losses and
prior service costs or credits that arise during the period but are not
recognized as components of net periodic benefit cost.&#160; The Company will adopt the recognition and
related disclosure provisions of SFAS No. 158, prospectively, on December 31,
2006.&#160; The Company is currently assessing
the impact of SFAS No. 158 on the consolidated financial statements.&#160; However, based on the funded status of the
Company&#146;s defined benefit pension, postretirement medical and postemployment
plans as of December 31, 2005, the Company estimates that total assets will
decrease by approximately $2.6 billion, total liabilities will increase by
approximately $0.2 billion and shareholders&#146; equity will decrease by
approximately $2.8 billion, net of taxes.&#160;
The actual impact of implementing SFAS No. 158 is highly dependent on a
number of assumptions, including the discount rates in effect at December 31,
2006, and the actual rate of return on pension assets for 2006.&#160; These factors could increase or decrease the
expected impact of implementing SFAS No. 158 in the Company&#146;s consolidated
financial statements at December 31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS No. 158 also requires an entity to measure plan assets and benefit
obligations as of the date of its fiscal year-end statement of financial
position for fiscal years ending after December 15, 2008.&#160; The Company&#146;s non-U.S. pension plans (other
than Canadian pension plans) are measured at September 30 of each year.&#160; The Company expects to adopt the measurement
date provision of SFAS No. 158 and measure these plans as of December 31 of
each year beginning December 31, 2008.&#160;
The Company is presently evaluating the impact of the measurement date
change.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">28</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\fc\30711747751_D11265_1457033\21892-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Nov  3 11:07 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"></p>


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed
Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
13.&#160; Income Taxes:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company accounts for income taxes in accordance
with SFAS No. 109, &#147;Accounting for Income Taxes.&#148; The U.S. accounts of the
Company are included in the consolidated federal income tax return of Altria
Group, Inc.&#160; Income taxes are generally
computed on a separate company basis.&#160; To
the extent that foreign tax credits, capital losses and other credits generated
by the Company, which cannot currently be utilized on a separate company basis,
are utilized in Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated federal income tax return,
the benefit is recognized in the calculation of the Company&#146;s provision for
income taxes.&#160; The Company makes payments
to, or is reimbursed by, Altria Group, Inc. for the tax effects resulting from
its inclusion in Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated federal income tax return,
including current taxes payable and net changes in tax provisions.&#160; Significant judgment is required in
determining income tax provisions and in evaluating tax positions.&#160; The Company establishes additional provisions
for income taxes when, despite the belief that existing tax positions are fully
supportable, there remain certain positions that are likely to be challenged
and that may not be sustained on review by tax authorities.&#160; The Company evaluates and potentially adjusts
these provisions in light of changing facts and circumstances.&#160; The consolidated tax provision includes the
impact of changes to accruals deemed necessary.&#160;
Upon the closure of current and future tax audits in various
jurisdictions, income tax accrual reversals could continue to occur, which
could trigger cash reimbursements from Altria Group, Inc.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the first quarter of
2006, the United States Internal Revenue Service concluded its examination of
Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated tax returns for the years 1996 through 1999
and issued a final Revenue Agents Report on March 15, 2006.&#160;&#160; Consequently, Altria Group, Inc. reimbursed
the Company in cash for unrequired federal tax reserves of $337 million and
pre-tax interest of $46 million ($29 million after-tax).&#160; The Company also recognized net state tax
reversals of $39 million, resulting in a total net earnings benefit of $405
million or $0.24 per diluted share, for the nine months ended September 30,
2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July 2006, the FASB
issued FASB Interpretation No. 48, &#147;Accounting for the Uncertainty in Income
Taxes - an interpretation of FASB Statement No. 109,&#148; which will become
effective for the Company on January 1, 2007.&#160;
The Interpretation prescribes a recognition threshold and a measurement
attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax
position taken in a tax return.&#160; The
Company and Altria Group, Inc. are presently evaluating the impact of FASB
Interpretation No. 48 and currently believe that its adoption will result in an
increase to shareholders&#146; equity on January 1, 2007, which might be
significant.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
14.&#160; Other New Accounting Pronouncements:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September 2006,
the FASB issued SFAS No. 157 &#147;Fair Value Measurements,&#148; which will be effective
for financial statements issued for fiscal years beginning after November 15,
2007.&#160; This statement defines fair value,
establishes a framework for measuring fair value and expands disclosures about
fair value measurements.&#160; The adoption of
this statement will not have a material impact on the Company&#146;s financial
statements.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">29</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\fc\30711747751_D11265_1457033\21892-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Nov  3 11:07 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="7%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.92%;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading -->Item 2.</p>
  </td>
  <td width="83%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:83.22%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">MANAGEMENT&#146;S
  DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.86%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="7%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="83%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:83.22%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FINANCIAL
  CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.86%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Description
of the Company</font></b><a name="DescriptionOfTheCompany_105725"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. (&#147;Kraft&#148;),
together with its subsidiaries (collectively referred to as the &#147;Company&#148;), manufactures
and markets packaged food products, consisting principally of beverages,
cheese, snacks, convenient meals and various packaged grocery products.&#160; Kraft manages and reports operating results
through two units, Kraft North America Commercial and Kraft International
Commercial.&#160; Reportable segments for
Kraft North America Commercial are organized and managed principally by product
category.&#160; Kraft International Commercial&#146;s
operations are organized and managed by geographic location.&#160; At September 30, 2006, Altria Group, Inc.
held 98.5% of the combined voting power of Kraft&#146;s outstanding capital stock
and owned 88.6% of the outstanding shares of Kraft&#146;s capital stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October 2005,
the Company announced that, effective January 1, 2006, its Canadian business
will be realigned to better integrate it into the Company&#146;s North American
business by product category.&#160; Beginning
in the first quarter of 2006, the operating results of the Canadian business
are being reported throughout the North American food segments.&#160; In addition, in the first quarter of 2006,
the Company&#146;s international businesses were realigned to reflect the
reorganization announced within Europe in November 2005.&#160; The two revised international segments, which
are reflected in this report, are European Union and Developing Markets,
Oceania &amp; North Asia, the latter to reflect the Company&#146;s increased
management focus on developing markets.&#160;
Accordingly, prior period segment results have been restated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2005, the
Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery business for pre-tax
proceeds of approximately $1.4 billion.&#160;
The Company has reflected the results of its sugar confectionery
business prior to the closing date as discontinued operations on the condensed
consolidated statements of earnings.&#160; The
Company recorded a loss on sale of discontinued operations of $297 million in
the second quarter of 2005, related largely to taxes on the transaction.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As previously
communicated, for significant business reasons, the Altria Group, Inc. Board of
Directors is looking at a number of restructuring alternatives, including the
possibility of separating Kraft from the balance of Altria Group, Inc.&#160; On October 25, 2006, the Board of Directors
of Altria Group, Inc. announced that it intends to finalize its decision,
including the precise timing, on the distribution of all Kraft shares owned by
Altria to Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s shareholders at its regularly scheduled meeting
on January 31, 2007.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">30</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\fc\3120356938_D10112_1472057\21892-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Nov  8 00:35 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Executive
Summary</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
executive summary is intended to provide significant highlights of the
Discussion and Analysis that follows.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated
Operating Results for the Nine Months ended September 30, 2006 &#151; </font></i>The
changes in the Company&#146;s earnings and diluted earnings per share (&#147;EPS&#148;) from
continuing operations for the nine months ended September 30, 2006 from the
nine months ended September 30, 2005 were due primarily to the following (in
millions, except per share data):</p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(70</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.04</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="77%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:77.44%;">

  businesses</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="77%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:77.44%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the nine months ended September 30, 2006</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,436</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.47</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">See discussion of events affecting the
comparability of statement of earnings amounts in the Consolidated Operating
Results section of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The unfavorable net impact
of asset impairment, exit and implementation costs on earnings and diluted EPS
from continuing operations is due primarily to the following:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring Program &#151; </font></i>The Company announced a three-year
restructuring program in January 2004.&#160;
In January 2006, the Company announced plans to expand its restructuring
efforts through 2008.&#160; During the nine
months ended September 30, 2006 and 2005, the Company recorded pre-tax charges
of $496 million ($331 million after-tax) and $173 million ($117 million
after-tax), respectively, for the restructuring plan, including pre-tax
implementation costs of $53 million and $61 million, respectively.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Asset Impairment Charges</font></i> &#151; The Company incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $86
million ($63 million after-tax)
in the first quarter of 2006 in recognition of the sale of its pet snacks brand
and assets, which was completed in the third quarter of 2006.&#160; The charge, which includes the write-off of a
portion of the associated goodwill, and intangible and fixed assets, was
recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated
statement of earnings.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">31</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\fc\3120356938_D10112_1472057\21892-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Nov  8 00:35 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition,
during the first quarter of 2006, the Company completed its annual review of
goodwill and intangible assets and recorded non-cash pre-tax charges of $24
million ($15 million after-tax) related to an intangible asset impairment for
biscuits assets in Egypt and hot cereal assets in the United States.&#160; These charges were recorded as asset
impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated statement of earnings. During
the second quarter of 2005, the Company sold its fruit snacks assets and
incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $93 million ($60 million
after-tax) in the first quarter of 2005 in recognition of the sale.&#160; The charge, which includes the write-off of
all associated intangible assets, </font>was recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed
consolidated statement of earnings.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For further details on the restructuring program or asset
impairment and implementation costs, see Note 2 to the Condensed Consolidated
Financial Statements and the Business Environment section of the following
Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gain on Redemption of
United Biscuits Investment</font></i> &#151; In the third quarter of 2006 the Company realized a pre-tax gain of
$251 million ($148 million after-tax) on the redemption of its outstanding
investment in United Biscuits.&#160; <i>For further details see Note 4 to the Condensed Consolidated Financial
Statements</i>.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Losses/Gains on Sales of Businesses</font></i> &#151; The 2006 losses on sales of businesses
were due primarily to tax expense of $57 million related to the sale of the
Company&#146;s pet snacks brand and assets in the third quarter of 2006.&#160; The 2005 gains on sales of businesses were
due primarily to the gain on sale of the Company&#146;s U.K. desserts assets in the
first quarter of 2005.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income
Tax Benefit</font></i> - The 2006 tax benefit reflects a reimbursement
from Altria Group, Inc. in cash for unrequired federal tax reserves of $337
million and pre-tax interest of $46 million ($29 million after-tax), as well as
net state tax reversals of $39 million, due to the conclusion of an audit of
Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated federal income tax returns for the years 1996
through 1999.&#160; Included within the change
in tax rates, among other things, are a benefit of $52 million in 2006 and $56
million in 2005 from the resolution of outstanding items in the Company&#146;s
international operations, and $24 million in 2005 from the settlement of an
outstanding U.S. tax claim.&#160; The 2005
income tax rate also includes benefits from the dividend repatriation provision
of the American Jobs Creation Act.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operations</font></i> - The $187 million increase from operations was due primarily to the
following:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher income in North America Snacks &amp;
Cereals, reflecting higher pricing, higher volume/mix and lower marketing
costs, partially offset by higher commodity costs and increased promotional
spending.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher income in North America Convenient
Meals, reflecting higher volume/mix and higher pricing.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher income in North America Cheese &amp;
Foodservice, reflecting lower commodity costs, higher pricing and favorable
volume/mix, partially offset by increased promotional spending.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher income in Developing Markets, Oceania
&amp; North Asia, reflecting favorable volume/mix and higher pricing, partially
offset by higher product costs and increased marketing spending.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher income in the European Union,
reflecting higher pricing, favorable volume/mix and lower fixed manufacturing
costs, partially offset by higher product costs and increased promotional
spending.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower interest and other debt expense,
reflecting lower debt levels and the redemption of higher coupon Nabisco bonds,
partially offset by higher short-term interest rates.</p>

<p style="margin:6.0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Partially offset by:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower income in North America Beverages,
reflecting higher commodity costs, increased marketing spending and higher
fixed manufacturing costs, partially offset by favorable volume/mix and higher
pricing.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower income in North America Grocery,
reflecting lower volume/mix and higher general and administrative costs.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">32</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\fc\3120356938_D10112_1472057\21892-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Nov  8 00:35 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"></p>


<p style="margin:6.0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For
further details, see the Consolidated Operating Results and Operating Results
by Business Segment sections of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated
Operating Results for the Three Months ended September 30, 2006</font></i>
&#151; The changes in the Company&#146;s net earnings and diluted EPS for the three
months ended September 30, 2006 from the three months ended September 30, 2005
were due primarily to the following (in millions, except per share data):</p>

  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">See discussion of events affecting the
comparability of statement of earnings amounts in the Consolidated Operating
Results section of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The unfavorable net impact
of asset impairment, exit and implementation costs on net earnings and diluted
EPS is due primarily to the following:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring Program &#151; </font></i>During the three months ended September 30,
2006 and 2005, the Company recorded pre-tax charges of $148 million ($94
million after-tax) and $42 million ($28 million after-tax), respectively, for
the restructuring plan, including pre-tax implementation costs of $23 million
and $16 million, respectively.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For further details on the restructuring program or asset impairment
and implementation costs, see Note 2 to the Condensed Consolidated Financial
Statements and the Business Environment section of the following Discussion and
Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gain on Redemption of
United Biscuits Investment</font></i> &#151; In the third quarter of 2006 the Company realized a pre-tax gain of
$251 million ($148 million after-tax) on the redemption of its outstanding
investment in United Biscuits.&#160; <i>For further details see Note 4 to the Condensed Consolidated Financial
Statements</i>.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Losses on</font></i><i> Sales of Businesses</i>
&#151; The unfavorable impact on earnings and diluted EPS from continuing operations
is due primarily to tax expense related to the sale of the Company&#146;s pet snacks
brand and assets in the third quarter of 2006.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">33</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\fc\3120356938_D10112_1472057\21892-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Nov  8 00:35 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operations</font></i> &#151; The $52 million increase from operations was due primarily to the
following:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher income in North America Cheese &amp;
Foodservice, reflecting lower commodity costs and higher pricing, partially
offset by increased promotional spending.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher income in North America Snacks &amp;
Cereals, reflecting higher pricing and favorable volume/mix, partially offset
by higher commodity costs.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher income in North America Convenient
Meals, reflecting higher pricing and higher volume/mix, partially offset by
higher product costs.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher income in Developing Markets, Oceania
&amp; North Asia, reflecting favorable volume/mix and higher pricing, partially
offset by higher product costs and higher marketing expense.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Partially
offset by:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower income in North America Beverages,
reflecting higher commodity costs and increased promotional spending, partially
offset by higher pricing and favorable volume/mix.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower income in the European Union,
reflecting higher marketing costs, lower pricing and increased promotional
spending, partially offset by lower fixed manufacturing costs.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower income in North America Grocery,
reflecting higher marketing and general &amp; administrative costs and lower
volume/mix, partially offset by higher pricing and lower costs.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For
further details, see the Consolidated Operating Results and Operating Results
by Business Segment sections of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">2006 Forecasted Results</font></i> &#151; In October 2006, the Company increased its
full-year diluted EPS guidance for 2006 to $1.86 to $1.89 per diluted share
from $1.78 to $1.83.&#160; The change reflects
the third quarter $0.09 one-time gain related to the Company&#146;s redemption of
its outstanding investment in United Biscuits (down $0.04 from a previous
estimate of $0.13 due to finalization of tax impacts and currency) and a
projected fourth quarter $0.10 one-time gain for the divestiture of the Company&#146;s
rice brand and assets.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Guidance also includes $0.40 per diluted share of
charges attributable to the Company&#146;s restructuring program and other
impairment charges, a loss of $0.07 per diluted share related to the divestiture
of the pet snacks brand and assets and a one-time gain of $0.24 per diluted
share for the favorable resolution of the Altria Group, Inc. 1996-1999 IRS Tax
Audit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company currently
forecasts its 2006 effective income tax rate to average 32.5% (down from 33%),
excluding charges for asset impairment, exit and implementation costs; the
impacts of the IRS tax audit resolution; and one-time gains and losses related
to acquisitions and divestitures.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The factors described in the
&#147;Risk Factors&#148; section of the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year
ended December 31, 2005 and the &#147;Business Environment&#148; section below represent
continuing risks to these forecasts.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">34</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\fc\3120356938_D10112_1472057\21892-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Nov  8 00:35 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Discussion and Analysis</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Business
Environment</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is subject to a
number of challenges that may adversely affect its businesses.&#160; These challenges, which</font> are discussed below
and under the &#147;Risk Factors&#148; section of
the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K
for the year ended December 31, 2005, include:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>fluctuations
in commodity prices;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>movements
of foreign currencies;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>competitive challenges in various products
and markets, including price gaps with competitor products and the increasing
price-consciousness of consumers;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a
rising cost environment and the limited ability to increase prices;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a trend toward increasing consolidation in
the retail trade and consequent pricing pressure and inventory reductions;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a
growing presence of discount retailers, primarily in Europe, with an emphasis
on own-label products;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>changing
consumer preferences, including diet and health/wellness trends;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>competitors
with different profit objectives and less susceptibility to currency exchange
rates; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:6.0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>concerns and/or regulations regarding food
safety, quality and health, including genetically modified organisms,
trans-fatty acids and obesity.&#160; Increased
government regulation of the food industry could result in increased costs to
the Company.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the ordinary course of business, the Company is subject to many
influences that can impact the timing of sales to customers, including the
timing of holidays and other annual or special events, seasonality of certain
products, significant weather conditions, timing of Company or customer
incentive programs and pricing actions, customer inventory programs, Company
initiatives to improve supply chain efficiency, financial condition of
customers and general economic conditions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fluctuations in commodity costs can lead to retail price volatility and
intense price competition, and can influence consumer and trade buying
patterns.&#160; During the first nine months
of 2006, the Company&#146;s commodity costs on average have been higher than those
incurred during the first nine months of 2005 (most notably higher coffee,
energy and packaging costs, partially offset by lower cheese and meat costs),
and have adversely affected earnings.&#160;
For the first nine months of 2006, the Company&#146;s commodity costs were
approximately $160 million higher than the first nine months of 2005.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">35</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\fc\3120356938_D10112_1472057\21892-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Nov  8 00:35 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">January</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">2004, the Company announced</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">a</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">three-year</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">restructuring</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">program (which is</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">discussed</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">further in</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font sty
le="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Note 2. <i>Asset Impairment, Exit and
Implementation Costs</i>) with the objectives of leveraging the Company&#146;s
global scale, realigning and lowering its cost structure, and optimizing
capacity utilization. I</font>n January
2006, the Company announced plans to expand its restructuring efforts through
2008.&#160; The entire restructuring program
is expected to result in $3.7 billion in pre-tax charges, the closure of up to
40 facilities, the elimination of approximately 14,000 positions and annualized
cost savings at the completion of the program of approximately $1.15
billion.&#160; Approximately $2.3 billion of
the $3.7 billion in pre-tax charges are expected to require cash payments.&#160; P<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">re-tax
restructuring program charges during 2006 are expected to be approximately $1
billion.&#160; </font>Total pre-tax
restructuring program charges incurred were $496 million and $173 million in
the nine months ended September 30, 2006 and 2005, respectively, and $148
million and $42 million in the three months ended September 30, 2006 and 2005,
respectively.&#160; Total pre-tax
restructuring charges for the program incurred from January 2004 through
September 30, 2006 were $1.4 billion and specific programs announced will
result in the elimination of approximately 9,200 positions.<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;
Approximately 60% of the pre-tax charges to date are expected to require
cash payments.&#160; In October 2006, the
Company announced that it continues to expect that full-year 2006 charges attributable
to the restructuring program and other impairment charges will total
approximately $1 billion, but now expects cumulative savings will reach
approximately $530 million by the end of 2006, down from the previous
expectation of $560 million due to the timing of activities.&#160; However, there are no changes to the total
cost or savings expectations over the life of the full restructuring program.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, the
Company expects to incur approximately $550 million in capital expenditures to
implement the restructuring program.&#160;
From January 2004 through September 30, 2006, the Company spent $197
million in capital, including $53 million spent in the first nine months of
2006, to implement the restructuring program.&#160;
Cumulative annualized c</font>ost savings as a result of the restructuring program were approximately
$260 million through 2005, and are anticipated to reach approximately $530
million by the end of 2006, all of which are expected to be used in support of
brand-building initiatives.&#160; Through
September 30, 2006, cumulative annualized cost savings for the program to date
totaled approximately $465 million.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenues from the <i>Tassimo </i>hot
beverage system have lagged the Company&#146;s projections. The Company is in the
process of evaluating its business model relative to this product, which may
result in asset impairment charges.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Acquisitions
and Dispositions:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">One element of the
Company&#146;s growth strategy is to strengthen its brand portfolios and/or expand
its geographic reach through a disciplined program of selective acquisitions
and divestitures.&#160; The Company is
constantly reviewing potential acquisition candidates and from time to time
sells businesses to accelerate the shift in its portfolio toward businesses &#151;
whether global, regional or local &#151; that offer the Company a sustainable
competitive advantage.&#160; The impact of any
future acquisition or divestiture could have a material impact on the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows, and
future sales of businesses could in some cases result in losses on sale.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the third quarter of
2006, the Company acquired the Spanish and Portuguese operations of United
Biscuits (&#147;UB&#148;), and rights to all Nabisco trademarks in the European Union,
Eastern Europe, the Middle East and Africa, which UB has held since 2000, for a
total cost of approximately $1.1 billion.&#160;
The Spanish and Portuguese operations of UB include its biscuits, dry
desserts, canned meats, tomato and fruit juice businesses as well as seven
manufacturing facilities and 1,300 employees.&#160;
Together, these businesses generated net revenues of approximately $400
million in 2005.&#160; Due to the timing of
the closing of the acquisition, the Company&#146;s results do not reflect earnings
from these operations, the amounts of which were not material.&#160; The non-cash acquisition was financed by the
Company&#146;s assumption of approximately $541 million of debt issued by the
acquired business immediately prior to the acquisition, as well as $530 million
of value for the redemption of the Company&#146;s outstanding investment in UB,
primarily deep-discount securities.&#160; The
redemption of the Company&#146;s investment in UB resulted in a pre-tax gain on
closing of approximately $251 million ($148 million after-tax or $0.09 per
diluted share).</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">36</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='36',FILE='C:\fc\3120356938_D10112_1472057\21892-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Nov  8 00:35 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As previously
discussed, the Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery
business in June 2005 for pre-tax proceeds of approximately $1.4 billion.&#160; The sale included the <i>Life Savers</i>,
<i>Creme Savers</i>, <i>Altoids</i>,
<i>Trolli</i> and <i>Sugus</i>
brands.&#160; The Company has reflected the
results of its sugar confectionery business prior to the closing date as
discontinued operations on the condensed consolidated statements of earnings.&#160; The Company recorded a loss on sale of
discontinued operations of $297 million in the second quarter of 2005, related
largely to taxes on the transaction.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the third quarter of </font>2006, the Company completed the sale of
its pet snacks brand and assets and incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge
of $86 million in the first quarter of 2006 in recognition of this sale.&#160; D</font>uring
the second quarter of 2006, the Company sold its industrial coconut
assets.&#160; During the first quarter of
2006, the Company sold certain Canadian assets and a small U.S. biscuit brand
and incurred pre-tax asset impairment charges of $176 million in the fourth
quarter of 2005 in recognition of these sales. &#160;During the second quarter of 2005, the Company
sold its fruit snacks assets, and incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of
$93 million in the first quarter of 2005 in recognition of this sale.&#160; During
the first quarter of 2005, the Company sold its U.K. desserts assets, its U.S.
yogurt assets and a minor trademark in Mexico.&#160;
The aggregate proceeds received from these sales during the first nine
months of 2006 and 2005 were $674 million and $218 million, respectively, on
which pre-tax losses of $14 million and pre-tax gains of $115 million,
respectively, were recorded.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July 2006, the Company
announced that it had agreed to sell its rice brand and assets for
approximately $280&nbsp;million. The transaction closed in October 2006 and
resulted in an after-tax gain of approximately $160 million or $0.10 per
diluted share, which will be recorded in the fourth quarter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The operating
results of the businesses sold, excluding the sugar confectionery business, in
the aggregate, were not material to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial
position, results of operations or cash flows in any of the periods presented.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">37</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following events occurred during the first nine months and third
quarter of 2006 and 2005 that affected the comparability of statement of
earnings amounts:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 22.5pt;text-indent:-22.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font> <i>Income Tax Benefits </i>&#151; In the first quarter of 2006, the United
States Internal Revenue Service concluded its examination of Altria Group,
Inc.&#146;s consolidated tax returns for the years 1996 through 1999 and issued a
final Revenue Agents Report on March 15, 2006.&#160;&#160;
Consequently, Altria Group, Inc. reimbursed the Company in cash for
unrequired federal tax reserves of $337 million and pre-tax interest of $46
million ($29 million after-tax).&#160; The
Company also recognized net state tax reversals of $39 million, resulting in a
total net earnings benefit of $405 million or $0.24 per diluted share, in the
first quarter of 2006.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 22.5pt;text-indent:-22.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font> <i>Asset impairment, exit and implementation costs </i>&#151;&#160; As discussed in Note 2 to the condensed
consolidated financial statements, the pre-tax asset impairment, exit and implementation costs were
included in the operating companies income of the following segments:</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">39</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='39',FILE='C:\fc\31203556796_D10112_1472057\21892-1-ee.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Nov  8 00:36 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
 <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 22.5pt;text-indent:-22.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="31%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:31.16%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Implementation<br>
  Costs</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
